item.title: Flickr - How not to design backup userdata when shutting down your service
item.description: Happy New Year - 2019 It is always easy to find fault than fixing. So this isn’t very hard to start this year blogging write a rant.

item.title: Dev Diary
item.description: This is something I’ve started in Jan ‘15. This is to practice a habit of keeping a log of stuff I do which took me a lot of time to figure out myself (may be I’m not efficient?

item.title: Image Slicing (Repeatable image) with Xcode Asset Catalog
item.description: Image slicing option in xcode asset catalog allows you to define resiziable area an image so it can be repeated to fit the object’s height & width.

item.title: Book Recommendation: Testing with coffeescript by Jack Franklin [Free ebook]
item.description: TDD (Test Driven Development) was introduced to me around 2006 with PHPUnit. As a naive, I couldn’t see the benefits, eg.

item.title: Expired distribution provisioning and Yak shaving
item.description: Last Thursday one of my iPad app’s provisioning file has expired. Client brought it to us at the very late moment, the iPad app was distributed internally as an enterprise app.

item.title: Resolutions for 2012
item.description: For the first time in history, I am publishing resolution list online, let see if this helps. Shed at least 5kg weight The iPhone4s which can’t resist myself from buying should be the last gadget for the year.

item.title: Recommended Git workflow
item.description: I recently started using Git as my revision control tool. Impressed by the use of branching and merging, I create and merge a lot of branches.

item.title: Capture screenshot of the app with iPad simulator
item.description: Until recently I was not aware of the shortcut Ctrl + Cmd + C It captures the complete content of the iPad simulator to the clipboard, You can save it to a file by File -> New from Clipboard with preview.

item.title: Random Notes: LAMP/Web development |Tools & Best practices
item.description: I was planning to write a post similar to this for very long time. My intension is to help beginners to know the jargons and best practices.
